 ∙ Refer the woman to the 24x7 PHC/FRU so that she can receive anti-hypertensive medication. She should be 
managed at home as per the advice of the MO. 
 ∙ Keep in touch with the woman or her family and undertake appropriate follow-up of these cases.
3. Convulsions—Eclampsia
 ∙ Eclampsia is characterised by:
 ¾ Convulsions
 ¾ High blood pressure (a systolic blood pressure of 140 mmHg or more and/or a diastolic blood pressure 
of 90 mmHg or more)
 ¾ Proteinuria
